# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceed. Provide an example

```julia
# Solution
function wrap_string(s)
    words = split(s, " ") # Split string into words based on space delimiter
    text_width = 10        # Maximum text width per line
    result = String[]     # Vector of lines with wrapped strings

    for word in words
        if length(word) + sum([length(x) + 1 for x in tail(result)]) > text_width
            push!(result, word) # New line is needed
        else
            push!(last(result), word) # Append to last line
        end
    end

    return join(result, "\n") # Join lines with newline character
end

# Example usage
input_string = "Hello there, this is a test of string wrapping. If the text width exceeds 10 characters per word, it will wrap to a new line."
wrapped_string = wrap_string(input_string)
println(wrapped_string)
```
